jobs.job_statement: When I am looking for events to join, I want to easily find the events and their details, so I can choose which ones to participate in.
jobs.current_solution: Using the website to check the calendar and event details.
pain_points: Difficult navigation requiring multiple backtracking steps.
No search functionality on the website.
Lack of clarity on registration status and event capacity.
jobs.desired_outcomes: A streamlined process for finding and signing up for events with clear status updates.
jobs.success_criteria: Ability to quickly locate events using a search function and easily access event details.

jobs.job_statement: When I need to sign up for events, I want a seamless registration process, so I can participate without hassle.
jobs.current_solution: Using the app for registration.
pain_points: Website registration process is slow and clunky.
Issues with captcha slowing down the process.
jobs.desired_outcomes: A fast and efficient registration process that minimizes unnecessary steps.
jobs.success_criteria: Ability to register for events quickly without technical difficulties.

jobs.job_statement: When I want to see what events I have signed up for, I want to easily find that information, so I can keep track of my commitments.
jobs.current_solution: Checking my emails or using the app.
pain_points: Difficulty in locating signed-up events on the website.
Inconsistent visibility of event registration status.
jobs.desired_outcomes: A straightforward way to view all my signed-up events in one place.

SAYS: I heard about Santa Barbara newcomers through one of the board members who helped bring me here to Santa Barbara.
I think selecting which ones you're going to participate in is a little daunting.
It feels very dated. The website appears very dated.
I think you could be using much newer or more innovative ways to get people's attention.
I never once used the website. I used the app.
I was looking for some committees that I had an interest in or that I had a shared interest in.
I think on your events page, having a calendar would be very, very helpful.
I think you need to be way more specific or have pictures showing the events that you're doing.
Too many words. It's way too much detail.
I just think it makes you look very small.

SAYS: I think it would be very useful if there was a way that we could walk new people through how to use the website.
Most people who are successful right away either go to the orientation and walk through it there or they meet somebody like Debbie Rare and have a personal view orientation step by step.

If there was some type of video or app or even a committee of people who would be willing to walk people through the website, the people that are sort of non-very computer literate would have a better experience up front.
I also think that the navigation can be improved because people have a hard time finding where they want to go.
I think it would be also good if the navigation was segmented by category, especially the 20 to 40s and the 40 and above.
It would be really important to include the day of the week of the events like Thursday or Friday because that's not always clear.
If you sign up for the waiting list, it's not clear how many people are on the waiting list.
It might be good to have that be also available in the summary.
THINKS: New users may feel overwhelmed when using the website for the first time.
There is a significant gap in website usability for less computer-literate individuals.
Improved navigation could lead to a more positive experience for all users, not just the tech-savvy ones.
Detailed information about events (e.g., day of the week, pricing, waiting list status) is critical for making informed decisions.
Segmenting information by age group could enhance user satisfaction and engagement.

data.opportunity_statement: How might we create a more streamlined training process for committee members to effectively use the website's features?
data.evidence: the training process that is undertaken in good faith is really not adequate to allow a committee co-chair to be facile in terms of how to understand and how to use to its greatest potential all the all the power of the system for organizing, you know, large scale events.
data.user_need: Committee members need comprehensive training to utilize the website efficiently and to manage events successfully.

data.opportunity_statement: How might we establish a formal archival process to retain knowledge and information across committee terms?
data.evidence: the lack of a formalized institutional memory... to be able to pass that baton to the next term... there’s not a facile way to have some kind of archival process.
data.user_need: Users need a way to access historical data and processes to ensure continuity and efficiency across committee transitions.

data.opportunity_statement: How might we enhance the communication of event details to minimize conflicts and confusion?
data.evidence: event descriptions and especially save the date kinds of things or conflicting scheduling things were not as transparent or not as clear as they could be.
data.user_need: Users need clear and transparent information about events to make informed decisions about attendance.

data.opportunity_statement: How might we implement a paid technical resource to assist with the back-office operations of event management?
data.evidence: there ought to be a paid technical kind of person that really could be there... to hold together the all the aspects of... getting these projects up and running.
data.user_need: Committee chairs and members need support for technical and logistical aspects of event management.

data.opportunity_statement: How might we improve the name tag process to enhance event organization and attendee identification?
data.evidence: having printed name tags as an audit function... If I saw anyone walking around with a name tag that was a pencil, sharpie, handwritten name tag... that was a clue that that person may not have been registered.
data.user_need: Event organizers need an effective system to identify registered attendees and ensure smooth event operations.

data.opportunity_statement: How might we develop a formal alumni network to strengthen relationships and engagement with past members?
data.evidence: to have a nice cemented relationship with a formal alumni group would be a positive... I'd be willing to pay 25 bucks a year for that privilege.
data.user_need: Users want a structured way to engage with alumni and foster community connections.

data.opportunity_statement: How might we ensure a seamless sign-up experience on the website?
data.evidence: I have on occasion... it just wouldn't complete. Like when I was signing up for something, it didn't. And so then I just gave up and came back later.
data.user_need: Users need a reliable and efficient sign-up process to avoid frustration.

data.opportunity_statement: How might we provide users with more information about events and attendees?
data.evidence: I use it to look at the events calendar... I look them up just to see what they say about themselves.
data.user_need: Users desire more insights into events and attendees to enhance their networking experience.

data.opportunity_statement: How might we promote the app to encourage more users to download and use it?
data.evidence: I don’t think I’ve downloaded the app... Do you have to download the app to use it?
data.user_need: Users need clarity on the app's utility and the benefits of downloading it.

data.opportunity_statement: How might we improve the website's directory search functionality?
data.evidence: I go to the directory to look people up... to see what they say about themselves.
data.user_need: Users require an easy and efficient way to search for and find information on individuals.

data.opportunity_statement: How might we enhance mobile accessibility for event information?
data.evidence: I look it up on my phone... I get...the calendar.
data.user_need: Users need easy access to event information on mobile devices without requiring an app.

data.opportunity_statement: How might we improve the navigation between calendar and list views to enhance user experience?
data.evidence: I want to go back to the calendar of events after clicking on an event... it goes back to the beginning of like many months ago. It doesn't start where I just left off.
data.user_need: Users need a seamless way to navigate between different views of event listings without losing their place.

data.opportunity_statement: How might we provide a clearer indication of event days of the week alongside their dates?
data.evidence: It often would put the date... but it doesn't say what day of the week it is.
data.user_need: Users need to quickly identify which days events fall on to better plan their attendance.

data.opportunity_statement: How might we create a dedicated alumni section on the website to keep former members engaged?
data.evidence: I would love to know... will they be listing alumni events that I can click on and look for?
data.user_need: Alumni need easy access to events and information relevant to them post-membership.

data.opportunity_statement: How might we enhance the visual appeal of the website to make it more inviting for users?
data.evidence: I think the visual in our website needs can use some small thing up a bit... just to be more attractive.
data.user_need: Users want a visually appealing interface that invites exploration and engagement.

data.opportunity_statement: How might we simplify the job form process to reduce complexity for users?
data.evidence: The job form is a nightmare for most.
data.user_need: Users need a simpler, more intuitive process for completing job forms.

data.opportunity_statement: How might we improve the accessibility of important documents like bylaws and governing documents?
data.evidence: It's not always clear where that stuff is... it's hard to navigate for things like policies and bylaws.
data.user_need: Users need easier access to critical documents to understand the organization's structure and rules.

data.opportunity_statement: How might we simplify the process of reviewing essential documents during the registration process?
data.evidence: I think I probably just clicked okay... I'm pretty sure I didn't read them and I just clicked okay.
data.user_need: Clarity and understanding of important documents before agreeing to them.

data.opportunity_statement: How might we enhance the app to allow users to easily contact committee chairs?
data.evidence: My only challenge with the app was when there was something that I couldn't do, I couldn't figure out how to tell the committee chair that I wouldn't be there...

data.opportunity_statement: How might we create a more intuitive navigation experience on the app to help users find relevant events?
data.evidence: The principal frustration... is just figuring out how do I figure out which things to look through, and having to scroll through a lot of things to say, I remember seeing something...

data.opportunity_statement: How might we implement a filtering system for events on the app and website?

data.opportunity_statement: How might we improve the visibility of event details such as location and organizer information?
data.evidence: It still just says private home... it now says Bethany Marshall, Noel Circle.

data.evidence: Because if there's 20 people on it, how many are you going to buy?
data.user_need: Users need guidance on whether to purchase tickets based on the likelihood of getting access.

data.opportunity_statement: How might we enhance the website's design to feel more modern and engaging?
data.evidence: It just feels like an old person's home, and it just could be spiffed up a lot with better photography, better typography, better layout, just all the fundamental things.
data.user_need: A visually appealing and modern website design.

data.opportunity_statement: How might we improve the event registration and tracking process?
data.evidence: I'm often looking for a particular event to register for. I'm often looking for what events am I registered to.
data.user_need: Easy access to event registration and personal event tracking.

data.opportunity_statement: How might we facilitate community engagement by providing a resource area for newcomers?
data.evidence: Wouldn't it be great if we could just have an area that's questions from people moving to Santa Barbara, with just basic information, where to register to vote, where to pay your taxes, how to get a driver's license...
data.user_need: Access to local resources and community information for newcomers.

data.opportunity_statement: How might we create a self-service support system for club admins and board members?
data.evidence: I'd like to have it be more self-service when it comes to customer support... if there were an easy way for them to resolve those issues in the moment.
data.user_need: Quick and efficient self-service support for administrative tasks.

data.opportunity_statement: How might we enhance the event calendar functionality for better usability?
data.evidence: I think perhaps would be to improve the calendar app, just to make it much easier to find events through browsing as well as searching.
data.user_need: An improved calendar interface that supports both browsing and searching for events.

data.opportunity_statement: How might we implement a help feature or chatbot for new users?
data.evidence: Perhaps would be a question mark in the corner, which got one to help or chatbot or left a message for the webmaster.
data.user_need: Accessible help and guidance for new users navigating the website.

data.POVStatement: Committee chairs need better training on the event management system because they struggle with the complexity of the process, hindering their ability to execute successful events.
data.SupportingEvidence: the training process that is undertaken in good faith is really not adequate to allow a committee co-chair to be facile in terms of how to understand and how to use to its greatest potential.
data.UnderlyingUserNeed: Effective training resources for new users of the event management system.
data.KeyInsight: Without proper training, new committee members feel overwhelmed and underprepared, affecting event quality.

data.POVStatement: Newcomers need clearer event descriptions and scheduling information because they often encounter confusion over conflicting details, impacting their ability to plan effectively.
data.SupportingEvidence: sometimes the event descriptions and especially save the date kinds of things or conflicting scheduling things were not as transparent or not as clear as they could be.
data.UnderlyingUserNeed: Accurate and accessible information about events.
data.KeyInsight: Clarity in communication is essential for engagement and attendance at events.

data.POVStatement: Newcomers need a way to document and share institutional knowledge because the frequent turnover of committee members creates a lack of continuity and memory for best practices.
data.SupportingEvidence: the lack of a formalized institutional memory...to be able to pass that baton to the next term.
data.UnderlyingUserNeed: A reliable system for capturing and sharing historical knowledge.
data.KeyInsight: Continuity in processes is vital for organizational success and member satisfaction.

data.POVStatement: Event organizers need a streamlined system for generating printed name tags because it helps in identifying attendees and managing registrations effectively.
data.SupportingEvidence: I like the printed name tags as an audit function...to quickly spot...anyone walking around with a name tag that was a pencil, sharpie, handwritten name tag rather than a printed name tag.
data.UnderlyingUserNeed: An efficient method for managing event registrations and participant identification.
data.KeyInsight: Clear identification enhances networking and ensures proper registration management.

data.POVStatement: Newcomers need user-friendly access to event registration data because it allows them to manage their events more effectively and ensure participant satisfaction.
data.SupportingEvidence: the notion of doing printed name tags...is an issue when you've got over 100 people.
data.UnderlyingUserNeed: Easy access to registration and participant data.
data.KeyInsight: Effective data management is critical for large event coordination and attendee experience.

data.POVStatement: Newcomers need a more vibrant and engaging online presence because a refreshed website can attract more participation from users who are seeking social connections.
data.SupportingEvidence: the good news and the bad news about newcomers is it reinvents itself every six months.
data.UnderlyingUserNeed: A dynamic and appealing platform for community engagement.
data.KeyInsight: A vibrant online presence fosters community involvement and participation.

data.insight_statement: Users with administrative privileges have a different experience than regular users, leading to insights about potential usability issues.
data.supporting_evidence: David mentioned, 'I had more problems with the phone app than I did with the computer based web application.'
data.why_it_matters: Understanding the disparity in experiences can inform design decisions to cater to both administrative and regular users, ensuring that functionalities meet the needs of all user types.

data.insight_statement: Users value clarity and transparency in event information but find descriptions often lacking.
data.supporting_evidence: '...event descriptions and especially save the date kinds of things or conflicting scheduling things were not as transparent or not as clear...'
data.why_it_matters: Enhancing the clarity of event information could improve user engagement and event participation, as users are more likely to attend events they clearly understand.

data.insight_statement: Institutional memory is lacking, leading to repeated learning curves for new members.
data.supporting_evidence: '...the lack of a formalized institutional memory... there’s not a facile way to have some kind of archival process...'
data.why_it_matters: Creating a system for preserving institutional knowledge can smooth transitions and maintain continuity, benefiting both new and returning members.

data.insight_statement: Printed name tags serve a dual purpose of identification and as an audit function for event registration.
data.supporting_evidence: '...if I saw anyone walking around with a name tag that was a pencil, sharpie, handwritten name tag rather than a printed name tag... that was a clue that that person may not have been registered...'
data.why_it_matters: Incorporating printed name tags can enhance event organization and registration verification, contributing to a smoother attendee experience.

data.insight_statement: Users prioritize utility over aesthetics in website design.
data.supporting_evidence: '...I want to do my business and I want to get out. And so from that perspective, cleaner, simpler, better is my approach.'
data.why_it_matters: Focusing on utility in design can lead to increased user satisfaction and more efficient interactions with the website.

data.insight_statement: There is a demand for a dedicated technical support role to assist with event management.
data.supporting_evidence: '...there ought to be a paid technical kind of person that really could be there, you know, as the glue to hold together...'
data.why_it_matters: Implementing a dedicated support role could relieve administrative burdens from committee members and improve event execution.

data.insight_statement: The organization experiences high turnover, affecting continuity and event planning.
data.supporting_evidence: '...it reinvents itself every six months... the learning curve just hits the peak at the time of transition.'
data.why_it_matters: A strategy to address turnover, such as extending terms or improving training, could enhance the stability and effectiveness of event planning.

data.quote: I didn't want to be first but if you insist.
data.significance: This statement reveals a reluctance to take the lead, suggesting a possible feeling of insecurity or anxiety in social situations.
data.insight: The user may need encouragement and reassurance in new social environments.

data.quote: This is without a doubt the friendliest place I have ever moved to.
data.significance: This highlights the user's positive emotional connection to the community, indicating a strong desire for social belonging.
data.insight: The user values community and warmth in their new environment, which influences their overall satisfaction.

data.quote: Whenever these you know when you have the app and you get a notification and it says four new things have been launched... it would be really great to have both on the app and the website the new things are highlighted.
data.significance: This suggests frustration with the current system's usability and a desire for clearer organization.
data.insight: The user struggles to navigate the information efficiently, indicating a need for improved user experience in the app/website.

data.quote: If someone cancels and you go to the waitlist... that was extremely time-consuming and then I did it wrong.
data.significance: This statement reveals the complexity and confusion surrounding the registration process.
data.insight: Users face significant barriers in the registration system, which can discourage participation.

data.quote: It would be nice to have the address in that reminder since it's only going to the people who are registered.
data.significance: This indicates a need for convenience and clarity in communication.
data.insight: Users are looking for more streamlined information that reduces their effort in event participation.

data.quote: I have to scramble back and figure out where it is.
data.significance: This expresses frustration with the lack of readily available information.
data.insight: The user is overwhelmed by the information management, indicating a need for improved communication tools.

data.quote: When I’m working because there are activities you cannot do obviously because it's during the day.
data.significance: This reveals a conflict between work schedules and available activities.
data.insight: The user desires more accommodating scheduling for activities that consider working individuals.

data.quote: I get a lot of emails... I cannot even know which one when I need to go back with the address.
data.significance: This highlights an overwhelming amount of communication that leads to confusion.
data.insight: Users may benefit from a more organized and less frequent communication strategy.

data.quote: Sometimes when it’s after working hours people think they do that don’t start any event at five o'clock.
data.significance: This indicates a misunderstanding of participants' availability.
data.insight: There is a need for scheduling events that cater to different lifestyles, especially for working individuals.

data.quote: I’ve lived in nine states and six years in Germany... this newcomers club is so perfect.
data.significance: The user's extensive moving history emphasizes their quest for community.
data.insight: The user values the sense of belonging that the newcomers club provides, showing the importance of community in their life.

data.quote: It's a great place to meet people and to do different things then you didn't even know existed in this town.
data.significance: This underscores the user's appreciation for the diversity of activities available.
data.insight: Users are eager to explore new opportunities and connections through the organization.

data.quote: I moved here based on criteria that I had for what I was looking for and high on that list was community.
data.significance: This statement reveals the user's prioritization of community in their relocation decision.
data.insight: Community is a fundamental value for the user, influencing their choices and satisfaction in their new environment.

data.quote: It's very easy to use for a person that's not really a computer person.
data.significance: This indicates the website's accessibility for users with varying tech skills.
data.insight: Usability is key for attracting and retaining users who may feel intimidated by technology.

data.quote: I chose Santa Barbara based on criteria that I had for what I was looking for.
data.significance: This indicates that the user is intentional and thoughtful about their living choices.
data.insight: Users have specific needs and expectations when relocating, which can inform how services are tailored.

data.quote: Does it tell you how many people are on the wait list for a given event?
data.significance: This question highlights the user's need for transparency regarding event popularity.
data.insight: Users are motivated by social proof; knowing the waitlist size influences their purchasing decision.

data.quote: If there's 20 people on it, how many are you going to buy?
data.significance: This statement reflects the user's thought process and decision-making criteria.
data.insight: The user evaluates their purchasing behavior based on perceived demand, indicating a desire to avoid missing out.

data.quote: That's a good point.
data.significance: The acknowledgment of the point indicates an openness to new information.
data.insight: Users are engaged in a collaborative dialogue, suggesting they value feedback in their decision-making.

data.quote: If there's one or two... That's a good point.
data.significance: The contrast between high and low waitlist numbers reflects user anxieties about event attendance.
data.insight: Users may feel more secure purchasing when demand is low, indicating a fear of commitment in crowded events.

data.quote: Yeah, because it shows you...
data.significance: The user connects waitlist data to their purchasing behavior, indicating its importance.
data.insight: There is a clear link between available information and user confidence in making a purchase.

data.quote: That's a good point.
data.significance: Repeated agreement signifies validation of the conversation and shared understanding.
data.insight: The user seeks affirmation from peers regarding their decisions, showing reliance on social influences.

data.quote: Yeah, yeah, yeah.
data.significance: The enthusiasm in the user's response indicates engagement and interest.
data.insight: The user is likely excited about the potential features and values them highly.

data.quote: That’s a good point.
data.significance: This phrase's repetition shows a pattern in the user's thought process.
data.insight: Users are processing information collaboratively, highlighting the importance of discussion in decision-making.

data.quote: How many are you going to buy?
data.significance: This question indicates the user's focus on quantitative measures when making decisions.
data.insight: Users quantify their interest based on social indicators, revealing a reliance on metrics for validation.

data.quote: It shows you...
data.significance: The user connects the feature directly to their understanding of market behavior.
data.insight: The user desires clarity and insight into market dynamics to inform their purchasing decisions.

data.quote: If there's one or two...
data.significance: The user's response indicates a threshold for comfort in purchasing.
data.insight: Users have specific limits where they feel safe and justified in making a purchase, revealing risk aversion.

data.quote: Yeah, because it shows you... Because if there's 20 people on it...
data.significance: The user's reasoning indicates an active analysis of potential outcomes.
data.insight: Users actively weigh the pros and cons of their decisions, indicating a complex decision-making process.
